Description: Hematite cylinder seal; the robed king with one hand raised faces a warrior god who holds a harpe-sword behind him, whose other arm is bent, and whose open skirt is short and has rounded ends; between them is a star and they stand on a base-line; space for inscription.
Bibliographic references: Leichty E et al 1988a / Catalogue of the Babylonian Tablets in the British Museum, volume VIII: Tablets from Sippar 3 (p.168)
Collon 1986a / Catalogue of the Western Asiatic Seals in the British Museum: Cylinder Seals III: Isin-Larsa and Old Babylonian Periods (409)
Acquisition name: From: Sir Ernest A T Wallis Budge
Acquisition notes: Acquired by the British Museum as a result of Budge's second mission to Egypt and Mesopotamia in 1887-1888; the mission was intended to investigate the "leakage" of tablets from sites supposedly guarded on behalf of the British Museum. Further notes on acquisition and bibliographic references relating to acquisition in catalogue introduction pp.xv-xvii.
